snippet: A DNA “bar code” of 23 snips from the genes of parasites that cause malaria can help scientists quickly determine where they originated, British researchers report.
abstract: Study published in journal Nature Communications reports that researchers are able to determine where strain of malaria originated by using DNA 'bar code' of 23 short snips from genes of parasites.
lead_paragraph: A DNA “bar code” of 23 snips from the genes of parasites that cause malaria can help scientists quickly determine where they originated, British researchers report.

headline.main: A Faster Way to Find the Origin of Malaria
headline.print_headline: A Faster Way to Find the Origin of Malaria
